content.body: err, yeah, I think this change does not have copyright, and I agree that this is editor discretion (who else would decide?), but also I think it's a good idea to generally try to get people to sign anyway if they haven't. Is this becoming too burdensome?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: err, yeah, I think this change does not have copyright, and I agree that this is editor discretion (who else would decide?), but also I think it's a good idea to generally try to get people to sign anyway if they haven't. Is this becoming too burdensome?

content.body: There is no Ecma infrastructure for having policy/opinions here--the W3C has that, but we're sort of on our own.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: There is no Ecma infrastructure for having policy/opinions here--the W3C has that, but we're sort of on our own.

content.body: I would suggest something like, pinging the thread to ask people to sign, and if a week passes and they don't sign and the change doesn't seem to have meaningful IP (as this one seems to not, and yes I agree the editors decide), then landing it. I agree that you shouldn't stress yourself out intensely chasing people down.
